SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.mostc.pftt.host
Class Host

java.lang.Object
  com.mostc.pftt.host.Host
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalHost, RemoteHost
public abstract class Host
extends java.lang.Object

Abstracts host management so client code doesn't need to care if host is local or remote(ssh).

Author:
Matt Ficken
See Also:
exec(java.lang.String, int, java.util.Map, byte[], java.nio.charset.Charset, java.lang.String), #test_cmd, DEV, isRemote(), readFile(java.lang.String), #saveText, getSystemDrive(), isWindows(), #join, dirSeparator()

static int DEV
          for development, set DEV > 0 (ex: DEV=1) and it will use PFTT/Dev-N/ instead of PFTT/Current/ and php-sdk/Dev-N instead of php-sdk this allows for running development versions of PFTT on same host as production(Current) version

 ExecOutput cmd(java.lang.String cmd, int timeout_sec)
          on Windows, certain command line commands aren't actually programs, but rather commands to CMD.exe Also, on Windows, if you want to execute a group of programs (ex: "A.exe && B.exe") you must use #cmd If this is windows, this will automatically execute the command with CMD.

Field Detail

DEV

public static final int DEV
for development, set DEV > 0 (ex: DEV=1) and it will use PFTT/Dev-N/ instead of PFTT/Current/ and php-sdk/Dev-N instead of php-sdk this allows for running development versions of PFTT on same host as production(Current) version

removeFileExt

public static java.lang.String removeFileExt(java.lang.String path)
removes the file extension from file. for filenames like A.B returns a for all others (if . not found), path if path is a relative or absolute path (if path has directory|ies), the directories are not removed just .BBB

getOSName

public java.lang.String getOSName()
returns the name of the Host operating system. cleans up the name and returns it in a short standard form with CPU architecture and service pack, for example: Win 7 SP1 x64

getContentsDetectCharset

public abstract java.lang.String getContentsDetectCharset(java.lang.String file,
                                                          CharsetDeciderDecoder cdd)
                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                                          java.io.IOException
gets the contents of the file as single unicode string, automatically detecting the character set and converting the bytes to a string (supports exotic charsets like EUC-CN or SHIFT_JS). Note: this takes extra time, often most files can be read with just #getContents because they don't use exotic charsets

Parameters:
file -
cdd -
Returns:

exec

public abstract ExecOutput exec(java.lang.String cmd,
                                int timeout_sec,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> object,
                                byte[] stdin_post,
                                java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                                java.lang.String current_dir)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                java.lang.Exception
executes the given program

Parameters:
cmd - - program to run
timeout_sec - - maximum number of seconds program is allowed to run - terminated if it goes over
env - - map of environment variables to use
stdin_post - - bytes to pass to program's STDIN
charset - - character set to assume program's output is - otherwise it'll autodetect it, which is slower
current_dir - - current directory for the program
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
NO_TIMEOUT

isWindows

public abstract boolean isWindows()
returns TRUE if host is Windows this is a fast method which caches its values, so you don't have to do that in your code generally if !isWindows == isPosix

Returns:
See Also:
isVistaOrBefore(), isVistaExact(), isWin8OrLater()

getSystemDrive

public java.lang.String getSystemDrive()
returns the Host's SystemDrive. On Windows this is usually C:\\ but not always. On Linux, it is always /.

Returns:

cmd

public ExecOutput cmd(java.lang.String cmd,
                      int timeout_sec)
               throws java.lang.Exception
on Windows, certain command line commands aren't actually programs, but rather commands to CMD.exe Also, on Windows, if you want to execute a group of programs (ex: "A.exe && B.exe") you must use #cmd If this is windows, this will automatically execute the command with CMD. If this is linux, it just passes the command to #exec

Parameters:
cmd -
timeout_sec -
env -
stdin_data -
charset -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
exec(java.lang.String, int, java.util.Map, byte[], java.nio.charset.Charset, java.lang.String)

getLocalhostServableAddress

public java.lang.String getLocalhostServableAddress()
servers running on Windows won't accept sockets from localhost to 127.0.0.1|localhost. instead have to use the ip address of one of its network interfaces (Windows doesn't have a Loopback(LO) network device)
